message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.CY, cs.SE

This paper deals with security and privacy issues in the Stratum protocol used in Bitcoin mining. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also involves network communication and protocols, which suggests cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) as another likely category. Additionally, the paper discusses the impact of the attacks on the mining equipment owners, which could fall under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) or cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper proposes a new protocol extension, which could be considered as a contribution to cs.CY (Computers and Society).
